main_page.main_page_1: Tervetuloa mukaan juhlimaan 25-vuotiasta Informaatioverkostojen kilta Athenea!
main_page.main_page_2: Vuoden aikana kiltalaiset pääsevät tutustumaan tarkemmin Athenen historiaan sekä osallistumaan historiallisiin kiltatapahtumiin.
main_page.main_page_3: Juhlavuoden kunniaksi järjestetään paljon tapahtumia ja aktiviteetteja sekä kiltalaisille että koko Otaniemelle. Juhlavuosi huipentuu marraskuussa / joulukuussa Infoähkyyn!

events_0.information: Juhlavuosi alkaa rykäyksellä maanantaina 8.1. kun Athene 25 -toimikunta pistää pöydän koreaksi Athene XXV päräyttävällä vuodenavausbrunssilla. Saavu siis aloittamaan vuosi herkutellen kera kiltakavereiden ja selvittämään, mitä kaikkea juhlavuosi pitääkään sisällään!

events_1.information:
Tiesitkö, et porukka joka vetää paljon oliiviöljyä elää 10 vuotta muita pidempään? (vähintään!!) Ootko maistanut sun Pirkka ekstra-neitsytoliiviöljyä sellasenaan, tiiätkö miten se on tehty ja miten se vertautuu muihin öljyihin?

Nyt pääset testaamaan muutamaa hiton laadukasta (ja kallista) oliiviöljyä sekä oliiveja niiden takana – ihan vaan saapumalla paikalle. Listalla on mm. öljy Stefanon isovanhempien pihan oliiveista Bresciasta. Eri öljyistä löytyy yllättävän erilaisia hedelmäisiä, yrttisiä ja pippurisia makuprofiileja. Päästään myös kokemaan mikä tekee ekstraneitsytoliiviöljystä niin spessun.

Tarjolla on leipää oliivien ja öljyjen kumppanina, mutta suurempi nälkä kannattaa sammuttaa omatoimisesti ennen maistelua.

Yleisön suuresta toiveesta Athene järjestää kevään juhlaviikolla akateemiset tanssiaiset! Killan oma tanssitaituri Elias Pitkänen pitää ensin opetussession tanssilajeista, jonka jälkeen siirrytään itse tanssiosuuteen. Illan aikana tanssitaan livemusiikin tahtiin ✨ Tanssiaisiin et tarvitse mukaan omaa paria tai edeltävää tanssikokemusta, vaan riittää, että tulet avoimin mielin mukaan. Tänä iltana kaikki tanssii tähtien kanssa!

Koulutusohjelman ja killan 25. vuosijuhlan kunniaksi tuomme yhteen opiskelijat, alumnit ja henkilökunnan InfoXXV-seminaarissa. Päivää vietetään ensin upeiden puheiden parissa, jonka jälkeen pääsemme nauttimaan aina yhtä taianomaisesta seurasta ja luomaan ikimuistoisia hetkiä aina aamun pikkutunneille saakka.

for_guild.text_0: Kaikki athenelaiset ovat tervetulleita osallistumaan juhlavuoden järjestämiseen. Jos haluat järjestää tapahtuman osana juhlavuotta,
for_guild.text_2: juhlavuositoimikuntaan sopiaksesi asiasta. Tapahtumien järjestämiseen saa tukea sekä toimikunnalta että killalta, joten olethan rohkeasti yhteydessä ja osallistu juhlavuoden toteuttamiseen!

ball.text1: Athenen 25. vuosijuhlaa eli Infoähky XXV:tä vietetään loppuvuodesta - lisää tietoa syssymmällä

seminar.content1: In celebration of the 25th anniversary of the Information Networks programme and Athene, we bring together students, alumni and staff for the Athene XXV Seminar. The day will begin with great speeches, followed by a fun evening with friends, full of memorable moments until the small hours of the morning.
seminar.content2: We will hear six talks about the future landscapes of skills, careers, and meaningful work. These diverse perspectives come together under the theme Navigating Sustainable & Meaningful Careers. The era of clear career paths and stable job descriptions is diminishing - especially for highly educated professionals. We hope to give insights, examples, and visions to young and old professionals looking for ways to make a positive impact on the societies around us.
seminar.content5: We wanted the speakers to represent the diverse interests of information networks students and alumni. The line up of INFOXXV includes alumni and students, academics and professionals, and leaders and practitioners, with various perspectives into the topic. Here we asked the speakers to share a bit about themselves.
seminar.people_13: Sonia Zaki is a journalist for Helsingin Sanomat who follows topics related to work and tech. At InfoXXV-seminar she will talk about how a career can be found in a field completely different from the one you have studied. She will also share her experiences of the conflict that arises when you are passionate about your work, but you also want to have a life outside of it.
seminar.people_22: Navigating the Shifting Landscape of Work: Sustainability and Critical Thinking Imperatives
seminar.people_231: Hertta Vuorenmaa (PhD)  is a Research Program Director (Future of Work) and a University Lecturer at the Department of Management at Aalto University School of Business.​ She is also the chair of the The Finnish Association of Work Life Research (FAWORE).
seminar.people_232: Hertta is deeply passionate about ensuring the quality and sustainability of the Future of Work, consistently addressing this topic from various perspectives via her own research and teaching. Her speech at this event underscores key issues that demand our attention as we collaboratively strive to construct a more promising future of work.
seminar.people_33: Tuomo Laine is the co-founder and CEO of Twice Commerce, formerly known as Rentle. Twice is a fast growing commerce platform for the circular economy, for which Tuomo has now acquired millions of backing from international venture capital investors. Tuomo is passionate about using entrepreneurship for societal and environmental change, as shown by his acceptance to Unreasonable Fellowship. Tuomo's talk focuses on the concepts of professional antifragility, healthy relationship to passion, and work-life separation skills.
seminar.people_34: Tuomo has been hit by lightning, and many of his life views stem from experiences from those few milliseconds.
seminar.people_41: Mia Folkesson & Iida Saaristomaa (IV18), Impaktly Group:
seminar.people_431: Mia Folkesson is the founder and CEO of Impaktly Group. Impaktly enables leading brands to accelerate sustainability transformations in order to unlock new business opportunities and growth. Mia is a serial entrepreneur, a career management consultant and a lover of the great outdoors.
seminar.people_432: Iida Saaristomaa is a soon-to-be Information Networks alumni and working at Impaktly Group on a master’s thesis regarding productising sustainability competence development, passionate about finding meaningful ways to utilise service design skills on making our world more sustainable.
seminar.people_433: The focus of Mia and Iida’s talk will be on how companies transform, the role of continuous learning in organisational change, and its implications for individuals.
seminar.people_441: Mia has made a hole-in-one in golf.
seminar.people_442: Iida has made a hole-in-one in minigolf.
seminar.people_51: Risto Sarvas, Information Networks, Aalto University:
seminar.people_52: The Core of a Lifelong Education - Case: Information Networks
seminar.people_53: Risto is the director of the Information Networks programme. In his talk he solves the puzzle of what and how to learn when future skills, careers and job titles are uncertain. In other words, what are the core skills of a highly educated professional in a world where change seems to be the only constant thing.
seminar.people_54: “I have never graduated from elementary school, i.e. the Finnish 9th grade.”
seminar.people_63: Elina is a 6th year student of Information Networks, combining studies in ethics, humans and design. In her talk she focuses on the future of work, and the promise of meaningfulness in our careers and in our world. How is a meaningful future built, what makes it worth building, and who builds it?
seminar.people_64: “I’ve sung Bohemian Rhapsody on the main stage of Slush Music.”
seminar.people_72: Race against irrelevancy: a story of modern education
seminar.people_73: Tino is a second-year student at Information Networks. His talk will discuss how staying competitive in the modern job market requires constant re-learning of technologies, and how it affects students planning their studies.
seminar.people_74: Tino won the Lego Masters Finland contest two years ago.
